revisions.rev:
{{cleanup-linkrot|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox Artist Discography |Artist = [[Diana Ross]] |Image = Nobel_Peace_Prize_Concert_2008_Diana_Ross1.jpg |Caption = Diana Ross performing at the 2008 [[Nobel Peace Prize]] concert in [[Oslo]] |Alt = A woman in a long white coat singing into a microphone. |Studio = 24 |Live = 5 |Compilation = 11 |Soundtrack = 4 |Singles = 90 |1Option = |1Option name = Other albums |1Option link = Other albums |1Option color = #faebd7 |Music videos = |References = Yes }} This article presents the '''[[discography]]''' of [[United States|American]] [[Musician|recording artist]] '''[[Diana Ross]]''', the former lead singer of [[The Supremes]]. It is a complete listing of all her solo albums and singles released. 27 of her singles reached the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Top 40 in the [[United States|US]], 12 of them the ''Billboard'' Top 10, and six of those reaching number-one, placing her in a tie for fifth among the top female solo performers who have reached the top spot there.http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/chart_beat/bonus_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003872634 In the [[United Kingdom|UK]], she amassed a total of 46 Top 40 singles with 19 of them reaching the Top 10 and two of those reaching number-one. In the U.S., 17 albums reached the ''Billboard'' Top 40, four of those the Top 10, and one album topping the chart. In the UK, 26 albums reached the Top 40, eight of those the Top Ten, and one album topping the chart. Ross sang lead on a hit single at least once every year from 1964 to 1996 in the UK, a period of 33 consecutive years and a record for any performer. ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center; |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Album ! colspan="4"|Chart peak positions ! width="130" rowspan="2"|[[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]
